SEARCH
Package AlgorithmCode

Class HashLogicOpTransform

java.lang.Object
AlgorithmCode.HashLogicOpTransform
public class HashLogicOpTransform extends Object
This class produces and verifies truth tables of logic gate transformation when hashed. If you take a codeword-produced 4x4 tile and combine it with another codeword-produced 4x4 tile via a bitwise 0-15 logic gate operation and rehash the tile, the logic operation between the original codewords and the result codeword becomes transformed into another logic operation. AND is 8, OR is 14. A logic operation between two inputs pre-hash becomes a different logic operation within the hash. Using these truth tables, you can operate on hashed input without lossy inversion and without the original data, allowing for retroactive hashing This class generates and verifies these operation transformations for all 0-15 logic gates and all 16 row-weighted hashes, the column-weighted hashes have an incomplete set of these transformations.

  • Method Details

    • testGate

      public void testGate(int gate, int[][] tupleDistro, boolean inRowError)
      This function tests a single 0-15 logic gate against all 16 minMax codeword sets rowError or columnError. This is a helper function for testAllGates()
      Parameters:
      gate - an integer representing a 0-15 logic gate, 8 = AND, 14 = OR, 6 = XOR
      tupleDistro - the output array passed from testAllGates()
      inRowError - if true uses the row-weighted truth tables; if false uses the column-weighted set

    • testAllLogic

      public void testAllLogic(boolean rowError) throws IOException
      Hash logic transform generator. This is the main function that generates the truth tables and calls testGate() for individual rules
      Parameters:
      rowError - if true, uses 2^row, if false uses 2^column weight on errorScore
      Throws:
      IOException

    • verifyLogicOperationHash

      public void verifyLogicOperationHash(String filepath, boolean rowError) throws IOException
      This function verifies that the hash logic op transform truth tables are correct by: 1. hashing the bitmap 2. generate an array of some changes to be made to the bitmap 3. hashing the changed bitmap 4. hashing the changes 5. combine the hashed changes and hashed original bitmap using the appropriate generated logic gate 6. testing to see if these two seperate hash pathways generate the same thing
      Parameters:
      filepath - name of the bitmap, not including the directory path
      rowError - if true, uses the row-weighted codewords, if false uses the column-weighted codewords
      Throws:
      IOException

    • generateOperation

      public int[][] generateOperation(int rows, int cols)
      Generates a binary array of some changes with which to test the internal hash operation transform
      Parameters:
      rows - number of rows to output
      cols - number of columns to output
      Returns:
      a random array of size (row, cols)
